Gaseous <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>HCl</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGibGaae4qai aabYgaaaa@3B7E@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> can be formed from its elements according to the following reaction.

<math alttext="H 2 gas plus C l 2 gas, reacts to produce 2 H C l gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>       <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup> <mi>S</mi> <mrow> <mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow> <mo>∘</mo> </msubsup> <mo>=</mo><mn>20.</mn><mtext> J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGuoGaam4uam aaDaaaleaacaWGYbGaamiEaiaad6gaaeaacqWIyiYBaaGccqGH9aqp caaIYaGaaGimaiaac6cacaqGGaGaaeOsaiaab+cacaqGOaGaaeyBai aab+gacaqGSbGaeyyXICTaae4saiaabMcaaaa@4BD8@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

Absolute entropy values for the reactants are provided in the table.

Substance
 Absolute Entropy <math alttext="in joules, per mole kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>J</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mo>(</mo> <mtext>mol</mtext> <mo>⋅</mo> <mtext>K</mtext> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.question: Which of the following is closest to the value of the absolute entropy of <math alttext="H C l gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>HCl</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
